definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: It requires a lot more than just being good at your job.
sentences.chinese: 那就需要在做好自己本职工作以外付出多得多的努力。

sentences.english: Its chief consequence is that they cannot do their job well.
sentences.chinese: 其主要后果是，它们不能做好自己的本职工作。

sentences.english: He is a professional at his job.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个精晓本职工作的人。

sentences.english: Strive for constant improvement and take responsibility for your own performance.
sentences.chinese: 力求上进并对自己的本职工作负责。

sentences.english: Thirdly, to master all the necessary know-how to do one's job well.
sentences.chinese: 第三，掌握所有基本技能，干好本职工作。

sentences.english: This employee treats his or her regular jobas secondary to some other interest.
sentences.chinese: 这类员工把对其他方面的兴趣替代了本职工作。

sentences.english: “This would hedge the exposure that exists in your labor, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “这将对冲你本职工作所存在的亏损风险，”他说。

definition: (to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
business in which a company has traditionally engaged (e.g. before diversifying)/original business/core business/(literary) agriculture
making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to treat the disease to save the patient/to criticize a person in order to help him
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
